it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<java.lang.String>

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer<java.lang.String>
    Manages a game in terms of the order of turns and players' actions. Receives messages from the network and handles them, modifies the model according to the actions of the players and the rules of the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller()
      Constructs a controller.
      Controller(Game model)
      Constructs a controller from an already existing game.

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Getter for model.
        Returns:
        current model.

      • newMatch

        public void newMatch(int nPlayers)
        Adds default players to the game, waiting for username and window from each client.
        Parameters:
        nPlayers - the number of players in the game.

      • newLoginRequest

        public void newLoginRequest()
        Sends a login request to all the players in the game, right after the start of match.

      • startMatch

        public void startMatch()
        Saves the reference to the turn handler created in the model, then initializes the model class. After the game is initialized, the match starts: the first player is selected and - in case he's already offline - the next player is recursively selected. A notification is sent to the player and the countdown for his turn starts.

      • setPlayerOffline

        public void setPlayerOffline(int playerID,
                             java.lang.String event)
        Sets a player as offline and checks if there's only one active player left. In that case the game ends, otherwise the game goes on.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the ID of a player.
        event - either disconnect or suspended.

      • nextPlayer

        public void nextPlayer(int player)
        When the next player is selected, notifies the previous player of the end of his turn, then checks if the now current player is offline, thus selecting a new next player recursively. Before sending a notification to the current player, checks if ten rounds have already being player, i.e. the game is ended and all player are notified of the winner.
        Parameters:
        player - the ID of the current player.

      • setWindowPattern

        public void setWindowPattern(int player,
                             java.lang.String windowName)
        Receives name of the window selected by a player, creates the window using a factory, then assigns the window to the player and sets the player as ready-to-play. If all players are ready, the game shall start.
        Parameters:
        player - the player's ID.
        windowName - the name of the window.

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String gson,
                   int player)
        Uses a parser to analyze a message, which is managed by the controller itself through visitor pattern.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        gson - Json representation of a message by the current player.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ChooseWindowMessage message,
                  int player)
        When a player chooses a window, it is assigned to him.
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(LoginMessage message,
                  int player)
        When a player chooses a username, it is assigned to him. If the username has already been selected by someone else, an error message is sent to the player.
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(LogoutMessage message,
                  int player)
        When a player disconnects, he's set offline in the model.
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(PassMessage message,
                  int player)
        When a player chooses to end his turn, picks the next player.
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(SetDieMessage message,
                  int player)
        When a player chooses to place a die on his window and all the rules are followed, notifies the player of correct result of his move. He won't be able to perform the same move in the current turn, however the turn goes on as he can still use a tool card.
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ToolCardAMessage message,
                  int player)
        Performs all the needed action regarding the usage of a tool card of this type.

        Tool cards type A change one die from the draft pool according to an identifier: tool card 1 increase or decrease the value of a chosen die; tool card 5 switch a die from the draft with a selected one in the round track; tool card 6 allows the player re-roll a die from the draft; tool card 10 flips a die from the draft; tool card 11 puts a die from the draft back in the bag, then a new die is taken from the bag and a new value is given to it.

        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ToolCardBMessage message,
                  int player)
        Performs all the needed action regarding the usage of a tool card of this type.

        Tool cards type B move one die in the window of a player: tool card 2 ignores color restrictions; tool card 3 ignores value restrictions.

        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ToolCardCMessage message,
                  int player)
        Performs all the needed action regarding the usage of a tool card of this type.

        Tool cards type C move two dice in the window of a player: tool card 4 does not have any restriction; tool card 12 moves two dice of the same color of a die from the round track.

        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ToolCardDMessage message,
                  int player)
        Performs all the needed action regarding the usage of a tool card of this type.

        Tool cards type D place one die in the window of a player: tool card 8 allows the player to place a second die in the same turn; tool card 9 places a die in a spot not adjacent to any other die in the window.

        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ToolCardEMessage message,
                  int player)
        Performs all the needed action regarding the usage of a tool card of this type.

        Tool cards type E do not need any validation: tool card 7 re-roll all the dice in the draft pool.

        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the current player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ShowTableRequestMessage message,
                  int player)
        Sends all the information regarding the public objectives of the current game, the personal private objective and all the tool cards (status and description).
        Parameters:
        message - the player's request.
        player - the ID of the player.

      • visit

        public void visit(ReconnectMessage message,
                  int player)

        Parameters:

        player - the ID of the player.
